result.execSummary:
The defendant Marcques Pj King was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Credit For Time Service 85 Days.
Defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration NOR the Substance Abuse Programs.

miscConds.notes:
Cost and Surcharge to be paid as a Condition of Probation at the rate of $45.00 per month starting 01-15-2015.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

No contact with Charles Patterson Jr. or Varnell Taylor Jr.
No contact with 2310 Hillsdale Drive East or any of it's residents.
Obtain valid driver's license with First 90 days.
Operate a motor vehicle with a valid drivers license.
Take a Criminal Thinking Course.
Fulfill legal responsibilities for son
Provide DNA Sample, if not yet provided.  Pay Surcharge.

timeConds.notes: Condition Time:  150 Days Huber - Non-working hours with standard release conditions - STAYED and to be used at the Agents discretion.
Each year of Probation.  During Last Year of Probation must be completed within the First 10 Months.

Order for commitment for Condition Time For Non-Compliance with Probation Conditions.  To Be Served at House of Corrections in Milwaukee.
Request for Condition Time and proposed Order for Commitment for Condition Time for Non-Compliance with Probation Conditions filed by DOC.

Defendant Marcques Pj King in court, in custody, with attorney Katie Beth Bricco.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Becky Van Dam, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE  PROBATION
The Court Orders the Following:
Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:
4 Years Imprisonment (Credit - 85 days )
-	2 Years of Initial Confinement
-	2 Years of Extended Supervision

Term of Probation: 3 Years
Conditions of Probation:
-	No contact with Charles Patterson Jr. or Varnell Taylor Jr.;
-	No contact with 2310 Hillsdale Drive East or any of it's residents;
-	Maintain/Obtain full time employment;
-	AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
-            Obtain Valid Driver's license within first 90 days;
-	Operate a Motor Vehicle with a Valid Drivers License;
-            Take a Crimnal Thinking Course;
-            20 hours of Community Service each year of Probation (during last year of Probation must be completed within the first 10 months)
-            Fulfill legal responsibilities for son
-	Provide DNA sample if not yet provided  and pay surcharge.
Restitution: $0
Fine or Costs: $528.00 (to be paid at the rate of $45.00 per month commencing January 15, 2015)
Condition Time: 150 days NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS - Stayed and to be used at the agents discretion.
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program
Sentencing hearing on December 22, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Marcques Pj King in court, in custody, with attorney Katie Beth Bricco.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Plea Colloquy.
Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.  
Court revokes bail.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 22, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Marcques Pj King in court, in custody, with attorney Kelsey Morin for Katie Beth Bricco.   Debra Lynn Blasius appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    The Court denied the Motion to Modify Bail.
Motion hearing on October 16, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
for bail modification filed by Attorney Bricco.
Hearing on December 1, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Search Warrant Executed October 9, 2014
Affidavit

Defendant Marcques Pj King in court, in custody, with attorney Katie Beth Bricco.   Susan L. Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Officer S. Alioto from the City of Brookfield was sworn and testified on behalf of the State. Cross examination by the defense. State rests. No testimony by the defense. State moves for bind over and presents arguments. Defense objects and presents arguments. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.   Bail remains as fixed.
  Hearing scheduled for December 1, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Attorney Katie Bricco for defendant.
Preliminary hearing on October 10, 2014 at 10:00 am.
